definition: to straighten out/to sort out/to organize
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: We must rationalize our regulatory system. The regulator must have the capacity to regulate comprehensive services.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须理顺监管体制。
她理顺了乱蓬蓬的头发。

sentences.english: Make smooth raw material inspection and storage procedures and strengthen rechecking of samples for witness of raw material storage.
sentences.chinese: 理顺原材料进库检验及储存，加强进库见证取样复检。

sentences.english: We cannot speed up the reform without rationalizing prices.
sentences.chinese: 理顺物价，改革才能加快步伐。

sentences.english: Zoom in, out, or use colored nodes to create order out of that chaos.
sentences.chinese: 放大，缩小，或者使用色标理顺想法。

sentences.english: Eighth, consummate the system of popularizing agricultural technique.
sentences.chinese: 八是完善理顺农技推广体系。

sentences.english: A men's T-shirt should be face down and smoothed out before you fold it.
sentences.chinese: 一个男人的T恤应该是朝下并理顺之前，把它折叠。

sentences.english: Want to keep your plaster pliable a bit longer to get it all smoothed out?
sentences.chinese: 要保留你的石膏柔韧多一点的时间来把一切理顺吗？

sentences.english: One, the relation that straightens enterprise of local power supply and provincial power company.
sentences.chinese: 理顺地方供电企业与省级电力公司的关系。

sentences.english: You should straighten up your ideas first.
sentences.chinese: 你得先把你的思路理顺。

sentences.english: The government is making unprecedented efforts to stanch the bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府正在采取史无前例的行动来理顺经济。

sentences.english: The distribution of the graduates needs to be straightened out.
sentences.chinese: 毕业生分配关系没有理顺。

sentences.english: A gentle, relaxing gel, formulated to help reduce puffiness and smooth out fine lines.
sentences.chinese: 柔和轻松凝胶以帮助减少浮肿和理顺幼纹。

definition: to unblock/to dredge/to clear the way/to get things flowing/to facilitate/to mediate/to lobby/to explicate (a text)
to do well at/to do a good job
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
to transfer/to maneuver (troops etc)/movement of personnel/to mobilize/to bring into play
to coordinate/to harmonize/to fit together/to match (colors etc)/harmonious/concerted
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
an overall plan taking into account all factors
slight or important, urgent or non-urgent (idiom); to deal with important matters first/sense of priority
top priority job/matter of vital importance
(of systems, facilities etc) comprehensive/well-developed/excellent/to refine/to improve
to put effort into sth/to try really hard
